statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: LeBron James hopes Thursday's matchup with the Orlando Magic is as successful as his Super Bowl commercial with Dwight Howard.
article.headline: Richmond wins fifth straight, creates three-way tie atop A-10
article.linkText: Richmond wins, creates three-way tie atop A-10
article.story: KINGSTON, R.I. -- David Gonzalvez scored 19 points and Richmond defeated Rhode Island 69-67 on Wednesday night. The Spiders (19-6, 8-2 Atlantic 10 Conference) shot 73.7 percent (14 of 19) in the second half, and used a late 9-1 run to win their fifth straight and move into a tie for first in the A-10 with Charlotte and Xavier. Richmond trailed 65-60 with 3:03 left, and Gonzalvez's 3 put the Spiders up 67-66 with 1:22 to play. Kevin Anderson, who finished with 16 points, hit a layup to put Richmond ahead 69-66 with 23 seconds left. Stevie Mejia then made one of two free throws for the Rams (19-4, 7-3). Rhode Island kept possession after Richmond lost control out of bounds on Mejia's miss. The Rams inbounded with 4.9 seconds left, but Cothran's 3 missed the mark with 1 second to go. Delroy James scored 13 and Cothran 11 for Rhode Island, which snapped a four-game winning streak.
